text:
I have a global command to deploy everything.
But yes the best solution would be separate into two folders..

Hello all, I have a custom made website navigation menu and I would like to add a light and dark theme so it could fit in different types of backgrounds. How can I add this option on the edit page level?

Hi, so for that you’d want to build a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules|module>.

Depending on the complexity of your menu, you may find the `menu()`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#menu| function> useful.

Regarding light and dark theme. how you actually code that completely depends. If you want it controlled at the module level, you can add a boolean or choice <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/module-theme-fields-overview|field> to enable choosing which theme, and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files#css-classes|use CSS to control which styling is applied>.

The other option is say you want it to base the light or dark theme off of the site visitor’s personal preference, and not be controlled by the content creator.

<https://css-tricks.com/dark-modes-with-css/|For that I recommend using CSS prefer-scolor-scheme>.
<@U7SL518D6> I will take a look at this documentation. Thank you for your help.

Hey, I've got a module with a boolean field called "include background". When I go to work on the page, it highlights that module with an error that says "The value in the field Include background is invalid." This happens regardless of whether or not it's checked, and when I echo the field it just shows "true" or "false", so I don't think there's somehow something weird saved in there. Any idea what might be going on?
Also some of the content on this page appears to have reverted to a placeholder, no idea if that's related.

did you by chance change the field type? i’ve been running into things where i change the field type and what’s in the database now doesn’t match (like, it was a color selector and now i locked it down to a choice list)
or check the usage of quote marks around t/f
I don't think this would have ever been anything but a boolean
And it was created in the UI, so I don't think there'd be anything weird in fields.json
HMMMMM. i literally just fixed three or four of these, but none was a boolean
oh well i created mine in the local tools, so yeah that sounds much less risky for you
not a reserved name or something?
Nah, it's just `include_background`.
what’s your default value
true
Oh also, this is a page that already existed and I don't think we had any problems with this module before.
I'm like 90% sure this is a HubSpot bug
could be.
did you just create the field
Nope, this module, the field, and the page have all been around for months
so i wonder if it’s a new error reporting type of thing — because i never got those same errors before today. but mine were definitely errors in my JSON file
Is there a technical reason that we're limited to custom module groups 3 levels deep? 4th opens up so much opportunity
Hey has anyone had luck making the HubSpot testimonial slider have the slides all equal heights? Driving me crazy :joy:
Thanks for the info <@U014A8JD9DH> !

Hi,
Can anyone tell me what's the major difference between a "Call-To-Action" default module and a "Button" default module ? It has almost the same functionality, except the styling part for the CTA module. Which should be used where in terms general best practice ?
